inn1.comm: over the wicket, sticks it on a length outside off, Kusal taps it down
good length, holding its line as Perera comes forward and drops into the off side, there's a shy at one stump from extra cover running across but he looked home, regardless of whether it hit
angled in a little straighter, pushed back down the track
length ball, straightening just a fraction on middle and off as Gunathilaka brings his bat down towards mid-on, hits the bat as he blocks
in the channel, trying to tempt his out, ignored
pitched up in the slot and this is dispatched, hint of outswing at 81mph and Gunathalika gets well forward to stroke the first boundary through cover
slanted across, slightly back of a length and Perera chases it, plinked off the toe but it whizzes through a gap at cover for three
short, climbing towards the body as the batsman jumps back and blocks down into the ground
seam movement back in, rapped on the pads, big appeal... but Michael Gough isn't interested. Think it pitched in line but might have been missing off, height possibly an issue
short of a length and nudged away
good length on the stumps and flicked through square leg for one

offers a bit of width, Gunathilika goes after it with an airy swipe, takes the edge... and Hales drops it at second slip! It was a hard, flashing chance, went very quickly to his right, but never looked like being held
over the wicket, touch short of a length outside off, goes back and across to defend
tip and run into the off side and that is very close to a run out! Gunathilaka was head down and charging for the danger end, throw came from mid-off and was a whisker away from hitting
Perera frees those Popeye/Sanath forearms and whips his first four away through midwicket, despite a valiant chase from the fielder
length around off, Perera happy to defend this time
touch back of a length, off-stump line, drops back and drills to mid-off
sliding on to the pads, Perera waits in the crease and nudges through short fine leg
good pace from Woakes, up at 87mph and slanted across as Perera drops back on off to defend
dug in short again and pulled away down in front of square leg
on the stumps, Gunathilaka gets into line and blocks
fullish, around off stump, goes for a drive down the ground and gets a thick inside edge to leg
length ball, comes forward and plays the ball into his pads
pushed across outside off, lets this one fly through - there you go, some leave action, at last
fullish length outside off, stabbed towards point from the crease
slotted back down the ground, that's gone all the way! Touch too full and straight from Willey and Gunathilaka gets forward to lever it over long-on, just clearing the rope
tighter line, 83mph from Willey, defended watchfully
hello, that's another Dorothy! Spanked through the line, bottom hand coming off the bat, sails high and handsome before plopping down a foot or two beyond the rope at long-off
gets into line and taps a length ball away
in the channel, no discernible swing for Willey now, left alone
pushed across the lefty, no stroke
short of a length, goes back and across and tucks off his body
banged in, good pace but worked into a gap on the leg side for one
fired across the bows, Gunathilaka frees his arms to slash through backward point, Plunkett does a good job diving in front of the rope to prevent a boundary
86mph, back of a length, Woakes seems to have abandoned any search for swing, defended
off-stump line and blocked from the crease
starts with a low full toss, which Kusal leathers through the covers coming forwards
good length, maybe nibbles away a touch, takes the edge but doesn't carry far and runs wide of the single slip

big swish, flicks the edge, Buttler grabs it! Gunathilaka's merry thrash is over, maybe a little bit of extra pace from Plunkett, he wasn't really very near the line of the ball and got a big fat nick through to the keeper to give England their first wicket
short and slightly leg side, Mendis hops across, called by Oxenford
on the stumps, Mendis moves into line and turns the ball towards midwicket
short of a length, Mendis rides the bounce pushes back down the pitch
length outside off, comes forward and taps down into the covers
full outside off, maybe a touch slower, mistimed towards one of the men blocking off cover
banged in and Perera gets on top of it to defend from the crease
shuffles across and nudges one through square leg
length ball, 85mph on middle and leg, flick of bat - maybe pad - and it runs towards short fine leg
banged in halfway down and Mendis dabs towards backward point, still can't get off the mark
shortish and leg side again
length ball on off, straight down the line, Mendis blocks to short extra cover coming forwards
full and splunked over point, bit of a thick outside edge as Perera aimed up and over cover, Jonny Bairstow hares after it but can't reel it in despite a despairing dive
shorter length and flipped into the leg side on the back foot
on the stumps, played back down the track towards the bowler
good length and again Mendis can't get it away

brings the ball back in, thumps the pads - and up goes the finger! Mendis never got going, seemingly unable to get to grips with the surface, played down the wrong line and he decides not to review, heading off for a nine-ball duck. Hawk-Eye has it just clipping the bails, so a tight call but would not have been overturned
draws him out to beat the outside edge, just a touch of seam movement from Plunkett, who's getting the ball to do a bit here
on the body, calmly nudged away through midwicket for one
slightly short outside off, poked down into the off side
on the stumps, stays back and dabs down to leg, there's plenty of time for the single
touch too leg side, glanced behind square and they trot one more for the SL 50
moves across and blocks on off stump
worked around the corner for a single into the leg side
Chandimal turns over the strike with another nudge off his legs moving on to off stump
on the stumps and worked into the leg side, Perera happy to accumulate for now
touch short, drops back and defends on off stump
comes forward to drive, this ricochets off the inside edge into the leg side
pitched up, tries to give Plunkett some tap this time, squirts off the toe through mid-on
back of a length, dropped down towards point and they think better of running as Roy fields
round the wicket, floated up on off stump and defended
angled in with the arm, Perera bows his head watchfully over it
tossed up and Perera moves across on off stump, works it into a gap on the leg side
over the wicket to the right-hander, Chandi walks out and clips through mid-on
here comes Kusal, coupe of steps down the pitch and whipped wide of mid-on, deep midwicket ends up running round to cut it off
pushed through on the stumps, lets it come on to the bat and glanced fine for one
in the channel, climbing through off a length, left alone
good length outside off, Chandi swings through the line, clunks off the inside edge
83mph outside the line of off, pushed towards cover
slightly full and Chandi latches on to it, the bat turning in his hands as he drives square, spins away from backward point and runs for four - the first in a few overs
drifts on to the pads and is this time clipped fine for one
goes round the wicket, good length on fourth stump, shows it a straight bat in defence
flighted and there's a hint of spin here for Moeen, raps the pads coming back in, half an appeal but probably outside the line
tossed up on the stumps, goes down early to pancake flip one down to fine leg
round the wicket, flat and fairly quick delivery on off, defended
darted in on the stumps, pushed back again
touch shorter and Perera goes back and punch through mid-on
tossed up on the stumps, turned through square leg for another single
length ball around off stump, quietly knocked back down the track
pitched up and Perera lumps him down the ground again, not quite as clean a connection as Gunathilaka managed and long-on keeps them to one
angled across the right-handed Chandimal, blocked on off stump
touch fuller, 82mph and inviting the drive, punched along the carpet to mid-off
straighter line, turned through the leg side
length ball in the channel, Perera moves across and pierces point for another single
tossed up on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
angled in with the arm, not much turn to speak of, defended again
on the stumps, touch too straight and it is worked through midwicket for one
tossed up outside the line of off, Chandimal is again down early, Buttler was anticipating the paddle and nearly managed to get in the way but it skitters past his legs off bat and pad
pushed through on off stump, turned straight to midwicket
stifled appeal for lbw, I think, from Buttler, as Perera comes forward and plays with bat next to pad
on the stumps, bunted back through mid-on for one
slides on to the pads, Perera tucks one through square leg
back of a length on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler

direct hit from backward point, Perera is well short! He was looking in good nick but Jason Roy has seen him off with an excellent bit of fielding, collecting and spinning to hit the stumps in the blink of an eye - and no need to even consult the third umpire. Bottom-edged cut down to Roy's left and he collected with his left hand, transferred to his right in one movement and then threw down the wicket. Guess it was Kusal's call but he'll be regretting it now
pitched up around off stump and he leans on a studious defensive prod
pushed across the bows, good length and Mathews raises his hands up and out of the way
good length on off, played with the turn but to the man at square leg
pushed through, comes across and taps into the covers
flat offbreak, spinning in slowly and nudged to midwicket
on the stumps, again clipped to the leg-side fielder
flat on middle and leg, this time Chandimal gets it between the two fielders
tossed up on off stump, gets out to smother it in defence
good length, sliding across outside off, goes back and opens the face to run one to third man
off-stump line, 82mph and staying a touch low, Mathews drops the bat on it
good length around the line of off, defended from the crease
pitched up, full and straight, Mathews rolls the wrists and clips one through midwicket to get going
fullish, tight line and defended
full length, 81mph on the stumps and tickled through backward square leg
outside off, down on one knee, a bit stretch to test the hammy, and thwacked through square leg! Shot
tossed up and firmly struck, back down the track
flicked hard to short midwicket, and a slight fumble rules out a fleeting chance to shy at the stumps
deflected to leg
down on one knee once again, and lapped airily over the shoulder to backward square
patted away with insouciance.
width, chopped hard to deep point, well snaffled with a tumble on the boundary's edge
clipped to backward square
tossed up and pushed back
pushed to cover once again, a very straight bat to combat the extra bounce
looped up onto a full length, swept fine
twirled onto a good length, outside off
lapped aggressively, takes a bit of a top edge but there's no-one there at deep backward square. Perfectly safe
wristy flick to mid-on, onto the front foot
swept - or at least an intended sweep. Instead, with his pad way outside off stump, he knees it with perfection past slip for an unstoppable four
eased down to long-off
clipped to wide mid-on
tossed up and patted back, hanging back in the crease
thrown out wide, Mathews waits on his stroke and pats an elegant drive into the gap at cover
a bit of drift and a fuller length, driven with an open face to cover
wide and chopped out to deep point. Rashid's variations demanding a measured response
a foot wide of off once again, cut to cover
maintaining a wide line, spinning wider, and a toe-ended cut to cover. Economical
eased out to mid-on
another kneed four through the cordon! Buttler was completely nutmegged, galloping down the leg-side to cut off an intended sweep. David Willey at third man dives valiantly to cut off the boundary
on the legs, worked square
width, chopped down through third man, another valiant dive. England have been sharp
worked to leg
shorter, a fraction of width and slammed through backward point. Emphatic
forward and blocked
big stride forward, poked to cover
sharp turn, that's well bowled, beating a loose poke outside off
tossed up again, smashed into the covers but straight to a well-placed fielder

that's ou... what? How is that neither lbw nor bowled? An attempted reverse smear to a yorker-length legbreak, Beats everything and somehow passes between Chandimal's legs before turning past off stump!
poked to cover
tapped to the leg-side
pushed down the ground, lots of flight and drift in the air
flicked in the air but perfectly safe through midwicket
another nudge to leg
worked off the face, round the corner
clipped again to square leg
swept, and swept fine. Turns towards leg stump and dispatched to the boundary
onto the front foot, pushed to mid-on
clipped to midwicket
angled defence into the covers, working with the spin
googly, but not quite directed. Chandimal doesn't pick it but his pad takes it out of the reach of Joe Root at leg slip
onto the front foot, pushed to cover
full length, a bit of late swing, defended from the crease
sharp pace but slightly off-line. Worked though square leg
on the legs once again and this time Chandimal is onto it with a fierce uppish clip through backward square. Good aggression
tight and straight
angled into the leg side but Moeen at short cover displays sharp reflexes to cut off any run
drilled so straight back down the pitch that it splatters the non-striker's stumps. Unlucky
tossed up and defended to cover
driven into the covers again
clipped to leg, working with the angle
tossed up and defended
impeccable line and length, defended down the ground
worked off the back foot to mid-on
flicked off the hip to fine leg
spanked! Down the track, a half-pirouette as Chandimal climbs into a shorter ball from Plunkett and pummels it through midwicket
outside off, flinched through a vacant cordon to third man
worked into the gap, Plunkett cranking up the pace but not entirely on the spot
flicked to leg
working with the pace and the slight angle into the leg-side, clipped off the hip
worked to leg
tossed up, deflected to backward square
on the back foot, pushed into the covers
defended with an angled bat out to cover
tip and run, a sharp single to short cover. Rashid is ticking a bit ... two hop-along batsmen shouldn't be able to steal a run there
looking for the second as Chandimal taps into the gap, they settle for the single
worked off the pads again, so many runs into the leg-side again
round the wicket, pushed to cover
driven down to long-on
tossed up and blocked
round the wicket, flicked to deep midwicket
ambitious appeal, Root did manage to get some turn, but it was from outside off and probably going over the top. Otherwise, close.
outside off, chopped to point
tossed up and punched down to long-on
lovely loopy line and length, held back in the air, and drawing an enthusiastic push down the ground
worked back to the bowler from a full length

gone! Down on one knee, attempted sweep, but Rashid's extra bounce takes the top-edge and lollipops to Plunkett at short backward square. A soft, soft dismissal from a man who was well set, in spite of his dodgy hamstring
googly! Welcome to the crease. Prasanna, not standing on ceremony, misses with an ambitious thwack
angled into the pads once again, flicked to deep midwicket
on the hip, flicked to backward square
angled prod down to third man
banged in back of a length, attempted swipe through the leg side, too tight to pull, and bounces over the wafting blade
repeat performance, banged in short once more, tight line, Prasanna gets violent at thin air
speared in fuller and straighter, chipped to mid-on and a direct hit would have been tight ... just in, I suspect

stunning catch! David Willey is so impressed with himself, he can only kneel on the sponsor's mat behind the bowler's head, grinning like a loon! A madcap wipe to a good-length ball, the chance spirals into the heavens, drops absolutely vertically at a rate of knots, and Willey sprints full length and skids his fingers underneath from mid-on as he all but collides with Alex Hales!
tossed up and defended
defended into the covers
wicket-to-wicket line, takes the pad but too high to elicit an appeal
googly, turning away from the left-hander as the slip lurks
onto the front foot to meet another googly. Defended again
turned off the pads
clipped on the up through midwicket
turned to leg, the right-hander's leg, this time
a hopeful appeal, tight line  but probably too high. And sounded woody
calm drive to mid-off
clipped to backward square leg
tossed up outside off, worked with the spin to midwicket
forward, defended straight as a die back down the track
dabbed into the midwicket region
deflects off the pad into the hands of slip, a bit of excitement from the crowd
tossed up again, flicked to leg
down the track, flicked to midwicket
dobbed on middle and leg, turned around the corner
stays round the wicket to Chandimal, who punches back to the bowler
tossed up on the stumps, worked through midwicket for one more to bring up his fifty - played, sir
touch short outside off, Tharanga drops back to cut but pings the ball to point
goes too straight and Tharanga picks up his first boundary with a pull, maybe off the glove, down to fine leg
floated up on the stumps, worked off the pads through midwicket
angled across, Tharanga goes back to dab the ball towards short third man
comes forward and punches one down the ground
floated up, gets Chandimal on to the front foot, pushed to mid-off
on the stumps, shuffles into line
tossed up, comes out and chops one into the covers
flighted, comes forward and dabs in front of mid-off, they scamper one more
gives it some air and Tharanga shows all his smarts by coming forwards and threading a drive through point
angled in on the stumps, worked into the leg side
flat on the stumps, turned to leg for one more
tossed up on middle and leg, Tharanga nudges to leg and they scamper through as the throw comes in
prodded away, can't get it through

nudged to leg, Chandi sets off but there's never a run there - he's sold himself down the river, England have another run-out! He realised pretty quickly but had already taken several steps down the pitch, Roy again was the man to sprint in and his underarm to Buttler allowed plenty of time to finish the job
pitched up fullish outside off, 77mph and pushed into a gap at cover
pitched up on off stump, Maharoof leans into a front-foot block
slightly too straight, clipped fine for a couple

bowled him, through the gap! Superb line from Willey, maybe a hint of movement back in as Maharoof comes half forward, pretty sloppy-looking push down the ground, bat away from the pad, the ball sneaks through and pop go the bails
fullish length around off, plants the front foot and blocks with a little more security than Maharoof managed
pitched up and clamped down into the off side
round the wicket, fourth-stump line, Tharanga drops back and dabs to third man
spicy bouncer from Plunkett, flies through around lughole height as Randiv ducks
fuller, around off stump, 85mph and pushed to cover coming forwards
dug in, rising to hit the thigh pad and loop behind square as the batsman stays back
back of a length, neatly tapped down in front of backward point and they get one comfortably
comes forward on off stump to block, finds a gap
pitched up around off, prodded into the off side, Randiv dives back for his ground as cover hurtles in and underarms at the stumps
quite full again and this time it's squeezed out in front of point
short ball, rising up over middle and leg, Tharanga swats it away through square
takes the pace off this one, Randiv works it to midwicket nevertheless
touch short outside off, stays back and steers into the covers
length ball on the pads but Tharanga is unable to capitalise, clipping straight to midwicket
Plunkett bangs in a short ball, Randiv ducks it
more chin music, Randiv again doesn't want to listne
chipped in the air... but short of mid-off, "oooh"s from the crowd as he reached the drive
uppish again, this time played with a horizontal bat through gully for one
edged but it runs away, flew wide of Buttler, fairly controlled and that's four for Tharanga
round the wicket, pitched up and dabbed into the covers
angled across, good length, decent bounce as Tharanga tries to cut, flashes past the outside edge
gets hold of this one, cracked through backward point but Bairstow does well to hunt it down in front of the rope
touch full, on the pads, worked through midwicket and Bairstow again hares after it in the deep, again keeps them to one
touch short, flapped through square leg playing back
ooh er, what's this... Randiv plays a sort of walking scoop, behind midwicket and in front of deep square leg, the crowd leers and whoops and the batsmen run a single
Tharanga can't get it away
on the stumps, worked off the body from back in the crease
Plunkett hammers the ball on a length, raps the back leg, a cross-seam delivery skidding on... probably a touch high, umpire Gough no interest in the appeal
jumps back and across, tapped down square
leans into a defensive push that squirts to backward point
sliding on to the pads, waits for it and plays a late flick round the corner for one
played off the back foot to point, Tharanga is backing up a long way and has to pull a U-ey as Roy hurls for the non-striker's end. Nup
good length, reaching for the drive, takes a thick outside edge... and it will run away for four, SL won't mind that
touch shorter, chopped into the off side
goes back and across and drops one behind square on the off side
cheeky from Randiv, this comes off pretty well, wandering across to paddle the ball past his stumps to fine leg for four more
drops short, wide of the stumps and carved over backward point, a tumbling stop on the boundary prevents back-to-back fours
slings down a decent yorker but it's swished away through square leg for one
length ball outside off, swings the bat and slices one over gully, down to third man
full and quick and Tharanga does well to chop down on it
drops short, Tharanga swirls the arms and pulls mightily and meatily over midwicket, just manages to go all the way
fired across outside off, squirted through backward point and they come back for two
good ball from Woakes, quick in the channel, past the bat as Tharanga fiddles half forward
shortish and slapped through the covers off the back foot, keeps the strike
short outside off, gives it some humpty and lofts four more over the covers into an untended part oft he field
goes straighter, full length and glanced through the leg side
pitched up in the blockhole, decent connection as Randiv drives back down the ground for two
full and straight, nudged off the pads for a couple more
frustration for Willey, who leaks four more with a slightly wide yorker that diverts past Buttler off the outside edge and away
slashed through backward point, they want two and will get them, Randiv running hard to get his bat through the crease as the throw came in and Buttler flicked it back on to the stumps
fullish around off stump, driven down the ground to long-off - that's his half-century, just a brief raise of the bat, he's batted well down in an unaccustomed berth
shortish, Randiv is on his stumps and gets it away off his thigh pad
pitched up outside off, punched through the covers to the sweeper - that's the SL 250
pitched up on off, blocked into the covers and they pilfer one more
low full toss, tailing away and sliced through backward point, they get back for a second
fired across, slightly wide and rising over Tharanga's horizontal swish, they run anyway and Buttler misses with a shy at the stumps

inn2.comm: nibbler! Perfect length, nipping off the seam and beating inside-edge before zipping over the bails! Cripes!
another inducker, raps the pads
gentle inswing, met on a perfect length by a measured clip in front of square. That's a lovely way to get off the mark
on the pads and sliding down. Helped to square leg
flicked fine, Maharoof's gentle pace shaping to leg
down the leg-side, we'll have that one again
better line and length, dabbed to cover
cutting away from a full length, chopped out to cover
lovely bowling, full length, and nipping/swinging away. Lovely pace, Roy has a prod but misses
swings, but too short and spanked through point
fuller length, tighter line, left alone
crunched out to point, more cunning swing from a full length
worked off the pads, and down to fine leg
full length, dobbling towards the pads. Blocked
defended out to the off side
belated flat-footed poke to a back-of-a-length trundler, as if Hales had time to leave the ball, and change his mind twice before the ball got there
worked to leg off the front foot this time
grief, that looked adjacent! Wicket to wicket, strikes the pad ... but, ah, there's an inside-edge. As you were!
outside off, chopped to point. An allsorts over, but a tidy one
down the leg-side
forward, drilled to cover
booming outswing, a late slashed attempt at a carve through point, but no contact
wicket-to-wicket line and poked back down the pitch
outside off, that's a jaffa, tight line and beats everything
up on the toes, punched to cover
clipped out to deep midwicket
worked into the gap as Hales keeps the strike
down the leg-side and that must have flicked something to prevent it being a wide. Pad presumably, or it would have been out!
nothing on this one, hooping down the leg side
edged, and in theory that sounded like a drop. But realistically that flicked the tip of the keeper's glove. Never a realistic chance
forward and thrashed through the covers. Far too full and wide to elicit anything but a pounding swing through the line
worked into the gap
forward and deflected down to third man
worked off the hip and a smart call to steal the run
on the pads, worked fine
right up to the toes
tall action, lopped down outside off
some lift of the wicket, chopped to point
smashed, in the air, but straight past Randiv's upturned fingers! If he'd got them in the way they might have flown to the boundary with the ball
worked into the covers
full length, probing off stump, worked to leg
forward, slightly uncomfortably, pushed back down the pitch
defended out to point, sharp scampered single
width, guided into the covers
open face, deflected to third man
pulled, and under-edged, inches short of Kusal behind the stumps! He partially fumbles, not quite onto the nearby helmet (which would have been five runs) but they rush through
clipped to leg, working with the spin
patted out to point
chipped in the air, not dissimilar to his first-ODI dismissal, but this time wide of midwicket
angled off the pad to short square leg
clipped to leg, another scamper
clipped to midwicket, so many runs in both innings coming in that direction. Easy does it
tight line, lifting onto a good length, defended
too wide to find the edge, but the extra lift off the deck draws the stroke all the same
crunched out to cover, picking off the fraction of width from back of a length
fuller and straighter, defended
on the pads again, worked fine, up comes England's fifty and it's been easy as they come
tapped in front of square out to deep midwicket
driven and edged! Beats the keeper and there's runs aplenty there
on the pads, worked into the gap
good length again
solidly forward
flicked out to midwicket, singles everywhere
faster and flatter, deflected to point
good off-stump line, flipped round the corner to square leg
well bowled, takes the splice and flies in the air briefly but not as far as point
outside off, climbs off the seam, excellent delivery
angled defence to point, a bit of a stuttery single, but they make it in the end
blocked
pushed into the covers, another single
tossed up, and driven down to long-on
worked into the gap on the on-side again, and out comes Mathews from slip to plug that very gap
Hales responds by pushing into the covers
onto a good length and blocked
hello, ambition! A quickstep down the track and a flamboyant wallop off a good length! Shot!
more intent, scampering to meet the pitch but this time clipping to mid-on
lifting off a good length, worked to midwicket from deep in the crease
worked out to square leg, and that is Alex Hales' 1000 runs in ODIs. Good work old bean
delicate dab down to third man
full face of the bat, into the covers
wham! Launched high over midwicket! A fractional err in length, and blasted into the stands!
back-cut to third man
dabbed to point
clipped to square leg, another run chalked off
outside off, attempted cut, no contact
pulls the bat inside the line of another good-length delivery
up onto the toes, poked into the covers
another nurdle to leg
onto the front foot, pushed down the ground
another pushed drive to long-on ... the lack of pace makes for a simple single
and again, a bit of drift, but just eased to mid-on
another single into the leg side
squirted to square leg, no way through this time
another single into the leg-side. It's one-way traffic at the moment
tight line, probing length, but Roy is shimmying at the crease and has the footwork for all eventualities
cut out to deep point, another easy offering
worked to leg. Again
outside off, chopped into the off side
full length, late swing but straight out of the hand, blocked from the crease
held back and glided to third man
worked into the leg-side again
big stride forward and blocked
worked to leg, another single
down on one knee and that is a fantastic way to bring up a very composed fifty! Slammed flat through cow corner, and England are cruising
full stride, full face, and defended to cover
flatter and quicker, but Roy adjusts well to pinch another single into the covers
tight line, and Roy adjusts late to defend to leg. Apparently there was a steward on the field for that delivery
forward and defended back down the pitch
open face, guided down to third man
banged in short, pulled firmly in front of square and that's the hundred stand. Excellent calm batting
defended into the covers
driven into the off side
good length outside off, Roy chops down on it towards backward point
crumped down the ground for four! Roy shimmies out early and slugs Pradeep back over his head, bit of boshty
punched through the covers coming forward
touch back of a length outside off, played with a straight bat, standing tall and steered in front of square
sliding down the leg side and helped on its way for one
85mph back-of-a-length delivery around off, Hales jabs it down towards his toes and bawls "Wait ooooooonnnn!"
tossed up from over the wicket, defended on off
pushed through a little quicker and straighter, turned to leg but the man behind square is quickly to it
flighted, comes forward to drive a single to long-off - and that's Roy's 50, first one in a while in this format, since England's UAE tour last winter
tossed up outside the line of off, stroked through the covers
full outside off, comes forward and steers one more out towards long-off
shuffles out and pokes another single through the covers
bumper from Pradeep, doesn't get up all that much but Hales flinches out of the way regardless
fuller length, sliding on to the pads and whipped through backward square, stopped on the boundary
banged in short again, flies through as Hales bails out of a pull - wide on height
launched over mid-off, Hales fetches his four-iron from the bag and hammers a boundary over the top
tight line on off, bit of pace and Hales chops it down in front of the stumps
decent ball from Pradeep and Hales is knocked off his feet, it was sliding down the leg side... That's a bruised toe in the morning
goes full again and this belted even more sweetly back down the ground, a proper rocket from Hales and lands just beyond the rope at long-off. Ticking along
short and wide and crunched through point for four more
tossed up and Roy skips out and work one down the ground
angled in and turned off the pads into a gap
flighted, Roy gets on to the front foot, poked into the covers
bit wider, there's some bounce and Hales rides it while cutting, sends the ball to backward point
comes forward and punches one more down the ground
slightly full outside off and this is splunked through the covers, squeezed out on the half-volley and it races away
full and straight, the keeper is up to the stumps, driven back down the ground
well wide of the off stump as Roy tried to upset Maharoof by moving across
slower ball outside off, Roy swishes gauchely and gets a top edge down to third man
wicket-to-wicket, poked back to the bowler
goes a little too straight and Hales helps it to leg with a flick behind square
on the stumps, tries to paddle to leg but can't get it past the fielder
creeps to the wicket and tosses the ball up high, punched down the ground
fancy handiwork from Roy, switches his stance and absolutely pulverises a reverse sweep past backward point
tossed up and smoked back down the ground this time, all the way! Clean swing through the line and it's into the boundary boards
pushed through a bit quicker outside off, Roy waits and dabs it late past the keeper for one
on the stumps, punched down the ground
flat off break on the stumps, playing with the gentle turn behind square on the leg side
tossed up, slightly leg side, turned towards square leg
gives it some air, comes forward and steers one back past the bowler
gives it a little more air and Hales takes the invitation to come down the pitch, blooters it towards long-off, powerfully struck but landing short of the man and he doesn't let it slip through
pushed through on the stumps, turned into the leg side
Hales goes down to sweep and gets a big top edge, lands somewhere between the keeper and fine leg, though
on the stumps, can't get this one away
round the wicket, tossed up on the pads and nudged into the infield
leg-stump line, tucked away through square leg for one more
floated up on middle, Roy opens up and drives down the ground to long-off
gives it some air, Hales sweeps and again balloons a top edge over the keeper for a few more
speared down outside leg, Roy swats at it and it deflects past Chandimal off the pads
floated up, goes down on one knee to sweep one more square
comes forward and pushes down the ground
high arm, not much turn, comes forward on off and blocks back down the track
on the stumps, again Roy sends it back the way it came, mid-on cuts off
tossed up outside off, punched to cover
on the stumps, worked across the line into the leg side for a single
downtown, sixer! Hales fairly leaps out to hammer a huge six into the crowd over long-on, takes him into the 90s
tossed up and smoked back down the ground for four more! This is now England's highest opening stand against Sri Lanka
pushed through, turned away towards point
pushed into the covers and he has to motor... but the throw, with only one stump to aim at, misses
on the stumps, swatted across the line through backward square
tossed up on off, Roy comes forward and eases one more down the ground. Ease being the operative word at the moment
floated up and punched back past the bowler on the walk
pushed through on the stumps and creamed through the leg side with a swingeing swing of the blade - he's on to 97

length ball, outside off, stays back and slams a cut through the off side, you can hear him bellow in celebration, knowing it is running away for four - that's Hales third ODI hundred, his first in England he's enjoying himself
tossed up on middle and leg, Hales opens his shoulders and smears it over deep midwicket for six! That's the England 200 up as well
goes again, six more over wide long-on, another beefy blow, marinaded into the crowd like the finest Bisto!
beastly! Six, six, six - another muscular mow across the line, he's middling every hit right now and England's target is less than 50
Roy now follows suit, a fourth six in a row, this time hammered down the ground! Sweetly struck through the line, more loft than slog, Roy getting his skates on, too
on the stumps, worked through midwicket gently for one
Randiv tosses it up nice and slow, Hales swings and misses as it turns down the leg side
on the stumps, can't get this one away
length ball, has a filthy smear across the line this time, hoicked out towards deep midwicket, landing short
tossed up outside off, Roy smacks through the covers, into a gap for a couple more
cutter outside off, Hales goes back and across and dabs one to short third man
swings across the line and squirts one through the leg side
Maharoof bowls very wide, aiming for the tramline, Hales swishes and gets a toe of bat on it, zips past short third man and away for four more
back of a length, rising up past the outside edge as Hales cuts... maybe the toe, as it was called wide

short and wide and it's come straight off the cue end to point... where Gunathilaka drops it! A dolly of a chance but it squirms away, to general amusement around the ground. Ironically, it seems to be impossible to get an England batsman out today!
sliding on to the stumps and flicked through the leg side
full and straight, Roy punches another single down the ground
tossed up and driven through mid-off
flighted, half a step and a punch back down the ground, Randiv stops it
slower, on the stumps, clipped down the ground for one more
looped up and swatted on the full over cover, off the toe of the bat again but it just clears the man leaping backwards! These two aren't leaving until the job is done
shuffles into line and nurdles down the ground
pushed through outside off and stabbed through point, Roy goes on to 98
on the stumps and flubbed through the covers for one more - fancy a flake with that, Jason?
tossed up, pushed into the off side
drops back and slaps a single through point
tossed up outside off, driven back and the bowler fields
pushed down the leg side, nearly a stumping chance but I think he had a foot back

speared in flat on the stumps, Prasanna is interested in the lbw, Bruce Oxenford isn't... the ball squirts away through slip, England take the leg byes, and Sri Lanka review. This looks on the speculative side and, sure enough, Hawk-Eye has it missing leg

full on middle and leg, Roy skips out and clobbers it hard back through mid-on, fine of the fielder, all the way to the fence in fact - lets out a roar of jubilation for his second ODI ton, a superb knock
tossed up on the stumps and flicked to leg
Hales moves across and nudges one more to leg
sliding down the leg side, Roy gets something on it and the ball runs away fine
full on the stumps, tapped through midwicket - that's the 250, another milestone ticked off
tossed up on middle and leg, closes the face and works square, they'll trot back for two
full on the stumps, defended back to the bowler. Plenty of time left
floated up outside off and drilled through the covers for four, sealed with a boundary! That is that, Sri Lanka knocked into a cocked hat as England win by ten wickets with a record ODI chase
